title: Lima Cooking Class
description: Discover the techniques to cook Peruvian food like a professional in a small-group cooking class in Lima. Under the guidance of a world-famous chef, you’ll learn how to make fresh seafood ceviche, marinated lomo saltado stirfry, and a pisco sour cocktail. Once the dishes are prepared, feast on your culinary creations. After the laid-back crash course, you'll be ready to make top-notch Peruvian food at home.
all_descriptions: Discover the techniques to cook Peruvian food like a professional in a small-group cooking class in Lima. Under the guidance of a world-famous chef, you’ll learn how to make fresh seafood ceviche, marinated lomo saltado stirfry, and a pisco sour cocktail. Once the dishes are prepared, feast on your culinary creations. After the laid-back crash course, you'll be ready to make top-notch Peruvian food at home.

ItineraryParticipating in this palate expanding activity will improve your knowlegde of Peruvian cousine and will greatly enhance your cooking skills. You will obviouly get to eat what you make, while being guided and instructed by our expert team. Our man, top of the line chef, Andres Rosas, is recognized around the world for his talent and superb skills in the kitchen.
P.º Soldado Desconocido 209, Cercado de Lima 15064, PeruThe cooking class takes place in Mirasol Restaurant located at Jr. Choquehuanca 209, Chorrillos 15064, Perú.
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.
provider:
Google. Google disclaims all warranties, express or implied, with respect to translations, including any warranties of accuracy, reliability, and any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and freedom from forgery.
Beatriz
5 contributions

Delicious ceviche and great cooking workshop!!

Oct 2023 • Couples
Wonderful cooking class at the Mirasol restaurant in Chorrillos, Lima. We had some problems with the reservation and they finally confirmed us directly by calling the restaurant. Andrés was a wonderful teacher and cook. To repeat!
Written October 20, 2023
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Jhoan R
3 contributions

Tasty and interesting!

Jan 2020 • Friends
We booked the cooking class with Andres since the place where it takes place was a few minutes drive from our hotel in Barranco. The cooking class was held at Andres's restaurant, which is very close to the beach and is also very beautiful inside and out. Andres is a self-taught cook who has invented many recipes and other recipes acquired from his parents. What we learned to cook was Lomo Saltado, Ceviche and we also made the most famous drink in Peru (Pisco sour).the class lasted about 3 hours and we had a great time.
Written January 19, 2020
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Carlos
2 contributions

Beautiful location, great food

Nov 2019 • Friends
Took a ceviche, lomo saltado and pisco sour class with my friends the second day of our visit in Lima. We really had a great time and learned a lot about cooking in general, not just Peruvian. Food was fantastic. This is a great activity for groups since you interact and of course show off your skill at the end hahaha...
Written November 3, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Jae Di Capto A
4 contributions

Best cooking class ever!

Oct 2019 • Couples
Andres was a great chef with a lot of energy and skills in the kitchen. We cooked Lomo saltado, ceviche and of course made 2 pisco sour, one classic and one with coca leaves. The cooking class took place in Andres’ restaurant (Restaurante Mirasol) and as that restaurant only works until 17:00 hrs we has the whole beautiful restaurant for us. Would recommend!
Written October 18, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
